articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from delegation of U.S. congressmen
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from delegation of U.S. congressmen 
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the delegation of U.S. congressmen on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned yesterday by Curt Weldon, vice-chairman of the Armed Services Committee of the U.S. House of Representatives, who is heading the delegation.

U.S. delegation of congressmen leaves
articles.content:
U.S. delegation of congressmen leaves 
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The delegation of U.S. congressmen led by Curt Weldon, vice-chairman of the Armed Services Committee of the House of Representatives, left here today by U.S. government plane.
 During its stay, the delegation visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. It also went round Kum Song School, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Korean Film Studio, the Pyongyang Information Centre and other places.
